subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms|alt=𩓐,膊}}
Attested since the {{w|Yuan dynasty}}. {{zh-ref|Zhengzhang (2002)}} proposes that it comes from {{och-l|襮|id=1|embroidered collar}}, but {{zh-ref|Sheng (2010)}} points out that it is unlikely because of the rare literary usage of {{zh-l|*襮}} in the literature compared to the explosive vernacular usage of {{zh-l|*脖}} since the Yuan dynasty; he instead proposes that it may be from {{bor|zh|trk-pro|*bōjn||neck}}.

subSections.text: {{zh-der|脖子|勒脖子|卡脖子|圍脖|圍脖兒|大脖子病|手脖子|抹脖子|拐脖兒|擁脖|掐脖子|氣累脖兒|牛脖子|窩脖兒|窩脖子|紅脖子|繞脖子|縮脖子|脖梗兒|脖梗子|脖領|脖頸兒|脖頸子|腳脖子|臉紅脖子粗|回脖|折脖子|殺雞扯脖|犯牛脖子|窩脖|脖兒拐|脖兒梗|脖子拐|脖拐|脖梗|脖項|脖領子|脖頸|膝脖蓋|花霾脖子|頂脖|頸脖|頸脖子|鷹脖色|黑脖溜粗}}

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms}}
{{zh-ref|Benedict (1979)}} relates this word to {{cog|bo|དབུས||middle; centre}}. Alternatively, {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}} relates this word to Proto-Monic {{m|und|*p[r/m]nus||navel}}.
